results.title: Concrete practice
results.brief_description: SUMMARY:The film examines formwork in building construction andiscusses the problems caused by pressure when concrete is placed etc. Handling and storage of formwork as well as the application of release agents are also demonstrated.

results.title: Concrete on the farm: making good concrete
results.brief_description: Making good concrete improvements on the farm. Strong, durable, economical and fireproof, they improve the property in value and appearance. Step by step, we follow the methods of concreting a holding yard for pigs; the selection, testing and cleaning, screenings, gravel and sand; preparing the foundation; marking the bay areas; pouring; levelling the surface; the non-slip finish; curing and finally ready for use. Other improvements to fence posts, silos and cowyards are shown.

results.title: Comrades: a Lanternist's account of the Tolpuddle Martyrs and what became of them
results.creator_credit: Bill Douglas, Simon Relph, Film Four International and Skresa Productions
results.brief_description: An itinerant Lanternist is witness to the rural unrest prevalent in Southern England in the early 1830’s. He arrives in the village of Tolpuddle where the farm labourers form a union and strike when their wages are reduced. Arrested and transported to Australia for seven years, the film follows the fortunes of the five men until their pardon and return to England. Bill Douglas’ only other major film after his autobiographical trilogy, is a similar homage to the oppressed poor. However, in spite of its subject matter, this is less grim. An important work from a great filmmaker. Cameo appearances from Vanessa Redgrave, James Fox, Michael Hordern, John Hargreaves and Robert Stephens.
results.title_for_label: Comrades: a Lanternist’s account of the Tolpuddle Martyrs and what became of them

results.title: Computers: The Friendly Invasion (Captioned)
results.brief_description: Extraordinary computer, graphics and spectacular scenes from the terrific Disney feature “Tron” illustrate dazzling computer applications and introduce students to a fabulous resource. You will learn how people working with computers, can build a better world in the future.

results.title: Computers
results.creator_credit: Victor and Ellen Landweber and Bailey Film Productions
results.brief_description: Describes the major components of a modern digital computer, and explores how the binary number system is useful in computer technology. The computer makes very rapid computations, and stores vast quantities of information.

results.title: Composition and function of blood (TEFC)
results.brief_description: What is concealed in a drop of human blood? What is the role of the blood? This film attempts to provide a detailed illustration of typical properties of human blood, with the aid of animal tests and valuable electron microscopic photographs.

results.title: Compilation: one hundred entertainments
results.brief_description: One hundred entertainments: Follows an acrobatic troupe in Shensi Province as they perform and talk about their lives. “Son of the ocean”: A film crew travels on a boat on the Yangtze and talks to some of the passengers.

results.title: Compilation: not so much a desert more a way of life
results.brief_description: Not so much a desert more a way of life: Much of Australia is described as desert, but wherever he looks, David Bellamy finds life among the sand and rocks. “The Great barriers” (prod. Mike Weatherley): Australia’s coasts are battleground’s where seaweeds, coral and mangroves fight for survival against the ravages of the ocean.

results.title: Compilation: il bruco the apple worm
results.brief_description: Three animated films by Bruno Bozzetto. “The Apple worm”: A humorous look at the troubles of an apple worm. “The Swimming pool”: A man who looks forward to using his new swimming pool is thwarted at every turn. “Self service”: A satirical cartoon about a group of enterprising mosquitoes.
